publicationStmt.publisher: University of Nebraska Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: STATEMENT of the AUDITOR of PUBLIC ACCOUNTS of the STATE OF NEBRASKA SHOWING THE APPROPRIATIONS MADE AND MONEYS EXPENDED By THE FIFTY-FIRST (SPECIAL) SESSION OF THE LEGISLATURE

p.seg: STATEMENT of the AUDITOR of PUBLIC ACCOUNTS of the STATE OF NEBRASKA Showing the Appropriations Made and Moneys Expended By THE FIFTY-FIRST (SPECIAL) SESSION OF THE LEGISLATURE October 28, 1935 to November 25. 1935 Legislative Expenditures Shown Up lo December 31, 1935

STATEMENT No. 1 APPROPRIATIONS MADE BY THE 51st (SPECIAL) SESSION OF THE LEGISLATURE Emergency Appropriations $159,706.68 State Real Estate Commission $ 1,600.00 Reappropriations . $ 7,500.00 Nominal Appropriations State Assistance Committee $4,513,000.00 State Assistance (Old Age Pension) 500,000.00 State Assistance — Reappropriation — Balance former Old Age Pension as of September 30, 1935 59,108.23 $5,072,108.23 STATEMENT No. 1-A EMERGENCY APPROPRIATIONS Appropriations made by the 51st (Special) Session of the Legislature' passed with the Emergency Clause and made available immediately. H. R. Acct. No. No. For What Purpose Appropriated Legislative Department 1 S2 Salaries of Members and Officers .$ 16,000.00 36 S3 to 5 Miscellaneous Expense 21,500.00 Department of Health 18 166 Maternal and Child Welfare Activities 30,000.00 18 167 Public Health Work 10,000.00 14 168 Public Health Work and Personal Training Services (Federal Funds) no estimate Military Department 23 232 Support 23,356.68 Board of Vocational Education 12 294 Industrial Re-Education 18,850.00 Nebraska Aeronautics Commission 22 360 Aeronautics Commission All Moneys Collected Estimated 35,000.00 Board of Control 24 Y690 Deaf and Blind Educational and Maintenance Fund 5,000.00 $ 159,706.68 State Real Estate Commission 32 65 State Real Estate Commissioner's Fund — Estimated fees collected $ *1,500.00 ♦(Available February 25, 1936) 5

STATEMENT OP THE STATEMENT No. 1-B REAPPROPRIATIONS H. R. Acct. No. No. For What Purpose Appropriated 35 E-59-A *"Director of Insurance — Litigation Fund" Specifically Reappropriated from E-59 — Banking Investigation, for the uses and purposes of the Director of Insurance for the Department of Insurance, State of Nebraska, in the sum of $5000.00 out of the unexpended balance for the purpose of paying the necessary costs and ex - penses for the prosecution of such suits as may hereafter be commenced by reason of irregulari - ties arising out of the administration of certain receiverships and other matters managed by the Department of Insurance $ 5,000.00 Attorney General 38 97 *Legal Protection — Legislators $ 2,500.00 A BILL FOR AN ACT relating to the legislature; to provide protection for members of the legis - lature acting within the scope of their official duties; and providing for the defense of actions instituted or now pending in any of the courts of this State against them on account of matters occurring in the course of or in connection with their service in the legislature; defining the duties of the Attorney General and/or Governor with respect to the same: to appropri - ate specifically the sum of Two Thousand Five Hundred Dollars ($2,500.00) or so much thereof • . as may be necessary for the remainder of 'the biennium ending June 30, 1937, for the pur - poses of this Act; and to declare an emergency. STATEMENT No. 1-C NOMINAL APPROPRIATIONS H. R. Acct. No. No. For What Purpose Appropriated 10 352 a. From state general fund malt beverage tax now on hand already collected from brewers and im - porters of malt beverages under Article 2, Chap - ter 53 C. S. Supp., 1933, which the State Treas - urer is hereby directed to transfer from state general fund and credit to State Assistance Fund $ 300,000.00 b. From state malt beverage taxes to be collected from brewers and importers and from gallonage taxes on hard liquors and on other fees and revenues arising under Chapter 116 Laws of Nebraska, 1935, Fifty- First (Special) Session of the State Legisla - ture, which State Treasurer shall transfer and credit to the State Assistance Funds, as there - in directed, commencing April 1, 1935 700,000.00 *The validity of these funds is questioned by the Attorney General, and cannot be made available without direction from the Court.

AUDITOR OF PUBLIC ACCOUNTS H. R. Acct. No. No. For What Purpose Appropriated c. From additional 1 cent motor vehicle fuels tax arising under House Roll No. 6 Fifty-First (Special) Session of the State Legislature 2,430,000.00 d.
